ARTICLE.TITLE: Gunman arrested, hostages freed as Manila mall siege ends
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Filipino elite Police Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) personnel take position at the entrance to a shopping mall following a shooting incident in San Juan City, Philippines, 02 March 2020. EFE-EPA/MARK CRISTINO

A security officer holds up a mobile phone showing hostages taken by the gunman in a video call witnessed by members of the media, during a press conference outside a shopping mall following a shooting incident in San Juan City, Metro Manila, Philippines, 02 March 2020. EFE-EPA/MARK CRISTINO

Filipino elite Police Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) personnel take position at the entrance to a shopping mall following a shooting incident in San Juan City, Metro Manila, Philippines, 02 March 2020. EFE-EPA/MARK CRISTINO

Filipino elite Police Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) personnel take position at the entrance to a shopping mall following a shooting incident in San Juan City, Philippines, 02 March 2020. EFE-EPA/ALEJANDRO ERNESTO PEREZ ESTRADA

A security officer holds up a mobile phone showing a video call with the gunman witnessed by members of the media during a press conference outside a shopping mall following a shooting incident in San Juan City, Metro Manila, Philippines, 02 March 2020. EFE-EPA/MARK CRISTINO

A disgruntled gunman who held 30 people hostage was arrested Monday night from a mall in the Philippines after hours of negotiations with police, in an event that left at least one person injured.

Police confirmed the hostages had been released from the shopping center after the arrest of Archie Paray, 32 – who was wielding a firearm and reportedly carried grenades – ending a 10-hour ordeal that began Monday morning in Manila.
